36407341.review:
English developer Stainless Software's "antidote to racing games" was originally intended to be a demolition derby type of game. Both the Mad Max and Death Race 2000 licenses were considered, but fell through, and what emerged from that was Carmageddon. 

Breaking from British racing game tradition, Carmageddon isn't about finishing first. I don't even think the opponents can actually finish the race at all. They just drive around, crashing into each other. It's more like Twisted Metal, but without weaponry. Each stage is set in a sandbox-type level filled with hundreds of pedestrians and a few armoured police vehicles. There are three ways to complete a stage. Either you do all the laps, but like I mentioned you get no competition from the opponents; you destroy your opponents by crashing into them, which can be a little tricky at times because it seems like you have to hit them at the right angle to do damage; or you run down and kill all the pedestrians, which can take quite a while. 

To progress in the game you have to increase your rank. You start at number 99 and have to work your way up to number 1 to unlock the last stage. In order to increase your rank you have to get a certain amount of credits on each stage, depending on which difficulty you're playing on. You get credits for running people over, crashing into your opponents, going through checkpoints, etc. You lose credits if you reset or repair your car, which is done by the press of a button while driving. The car kind of buckles out like in the John Carpenter film Christine, which is cool. There's a time limit on each race, which at first may seem kind of low, but you easily gain time in the same way you gain credits, except you won't get any time for actually racing. 

Controlling your car in Carmageddon isn't the easiest thing to do. I can't really think of a game with similar steering. When you're driving slowly you have decent control, but when you get up to speed and try to turn it's like the car understeers, or a slight turn could make you lose grip and spin out. I usually use the handbrake for cornering, drifting tens of meters completely sideways before gaining traction again. It could be that the lower than normal gravity impacts the steering. At least it effects the way you jump, which is quite cool and makes the game more unique. It's sort of like racing on the Moon. 

The game's biggest draw is being able to run people down and being awarded for it. It's not a very challenging game, but it's a relaxing one where you can just sit back and have fun. If you destroy your opponents cars you sometimes unlock them and can use them yourself. They all have a unique cockpit view, if you're into first person racing. Some of them have better steering, some are more powerful, and some are faster, especially a drag racing car which goes insanely fast but can barely steer. My favorite car is the one you start with, because it's the most balanced one, plus it's modelled after David Carradine's car in Death Race 2000. 

There's a handful of locations in the game, from the big city to the coast, a chemical plant, a winter resort, etc. You'll have to revisit these places a number of times, racing different routes. This gets a bit repetitious because the routes often cross previous routes, and if you drive around trying to destroy your opponents or kill pedestrians, it's basically just like playing the same stages over and over again, considering they take place in the same sandboxes. The game is a little too long for its own good, but if you play it a little here and there instead of plowing through it in a couple of seatings, it's great fun!

----------

Carmageddon Splat Pack, which is also included in the Max Pack, is an expansion for the original Carmageddon, containing a bunch of new levels and a number of new cars. There are new pedestrians as well, and some new power-ups, but since the levels are the main thing I'll give some short comments on those. 

Mayan Magnificence Hotels: Set in a Central or South American hotel resort with architecture resembling the ancient local civilizations. Well-designed map that is fun to play. 

MagnaChem Rural Developments Inc.: Rocky and green prison island surrounded by mountains. Not that exciting. Lots of fluffy sheep though. 

MagnaChem Abandoned Ice Station: Snowy industrial roads with gaps you have to jump every now and again. Nothing special. 

Craggy Isle Dam Complex: This map consists of two islands: one is bright and colorful, with palm trees and a small nice town, and the other is dull and gray, with a boring dam in the middle. 

MagnaChem Environmental Disaster: Kind of lackluster. A bunch of high bridges binding together a bunch of small dusty islands. 

Nerdberksring Race Circuit: Actually a proper race track. Adds some variation to the mayhem, but it would be nice if the level had some stunt jumps as well. 

Musty Ramparts Theme Castle: A large medieval castle filled with hallways. Good for smashing into the other cars. There's also a gravel road that goes through a decently sized outdoor area. 

And last but not least, and possibly spoiler alert since you only get to play this map at the very end: 
Hell: A big and confusing map that takes place in the underworld, complete with a graveyard, lava pits and burning demons, a flaming bar, Eskimos on ice, and the Devil himself. Takes some time to learn, but once you know how to get around the level is pretty fun. 

----------

This release isn't exactly remastered, but I could get it to play fine in 1920x1080. It runs through DOSBox and works fairly well. I'll give it a solid 3 out of 5 car crashes!

35480545.review:
Carmageddon... Le top du top en matière de controverse à sa sortie en 1997. Ce jeu de course, ou plutôt de combat motorisé, a construit sa notoriété sur la possibilité de rouler sur les piétons avec moult effets gores à la clé. Fort heureusement, le titre a plus à offrir qu'une collection de sprites sanguinolents. Il y a d'abord la conduite très spéciale : les véhicules sont lourds et réagissent logiquement à tous les impacts tandis que la gravité du jeu est très faible. Un curieux mélange qui donne à la fois des sensations réalistes mais engendre aussi des cascades démentes. il y a également la gestion des dégâts : la voiture se déforme en fonction des chocs subis et reprend gracieusement sa forme d'origine sur demande. Une petite prouesse technique pour l'époque. Si on ne peut pas parler de monde ouvert, on a clairement droit à un gameplay sandbox puisqu'il est possible d'explorer comme bon nous semble les environnements. Chaque course peut être terminée de trois manières : soit en finissant le nombre de tours imposé, soit en éliminant tous les concurrents soit en écrabouillant tous les piétons du coin. Si les deux premières options sont viables, la troisième est réservée aux vrais psychopathes compte tenu du nombre élevé de piétons dans chaque lieu et de la difficulté de tous les atteindre. Cette version 'Max Pack' comprend également le Splat Pack, l'extension officielle du jeu. Celle-ci ajoute une quantité respectable de contenu avec de nouveaux véhicules, circuits, piétons et même une nouvelle bande-son ; quasiment un second jeu en termes de durée de vie.
Alors faut-il jouer à Carmageddon de nos jours ? Si on n'y a jamais touché, non. Les graphismes piquent les yeux et il y a de toutes façons la version Max Damage de 2015 pour découvrir la série. Si on y a joué à l'époque, la nostalgie et le gameplay bourrin feront très certainement effet !

34395475.review:
Carmageddon - игра от Stainless Games, взорвавшая мозг всех, кто играл в нее в свое время. Игра вышла в 1997 году, для игровой индустрии этот год был одним из самых бурлящих.

[h1]Сюжет[/h1]

Вы гонщик и вам нужно победить во всех гонках. Еее!!!

[h1]Геймплей[/h1]

Вам необходимо пройти все гонки, для победы в каждой необходимо прийти первым, уничтожить всех соперников или задавить всех  пешеходов на уровне. Если первые два способа довольно просты и доставляют больше всего, то третий - невыносимо нудное и скучное занятие для настоящих задротов, ибо на каждой карте в среднем по 400 пешеходов. По самой трассе разбросаны различные бонусы, они как могут помочь, так и могут навредить: одни дают деньги, время; вторые улучшают скорость авто, третие же просто откидывают через всю карту со скоростью, вплоть до световой. Игрок имеет возможность менять автомобили и прокачивать их, используя деньги, которые получает за выигрыш и разные действия в самой гонке. Также во время гонки можно чинить авто и восстанавливаться (респауниться инными словами, но это не починит вспыхнувший мотор, к примеру). В отличие от многих гоночных игр того времени, Carmageddon вызывал у игрока разрыв шаблона своей динамичностью и драйвом. Ни в одной гонке нельзя было нагло лишать своих соперников железного коня, наматывать кишки пешеходов [spoiler]или коров[/spoiler] на колеса, или, например, поездить по стенам для добычи бочки с баблом; Большинство лишь предлагало амбициозную 3D перспективу и возможность рулить до финиша. В нашем же случае, свобода действий неограничена, ведь Carmageddon - гонки без правил. Как утверждают сами разработчики кстати, им надоели обычные гонки, им захотелось большего, как и многим нам. Говоря про новаторство, им стал сам жанр, а вот бить автомобили и выбирать их можно как минимум в Chase H.Q.

Да что ты знаешь о Carmageddon'е? То что это обычная гоночка без правил? Да в Carmageddon'е каждый игрок становится бесчувственным маньяком, давя всех и вся, что видит на собственном экране. Доставляет даже курсор меню в виде оторванной руки с неиссекаемым количеством вытекающей из нее крови. Все что останется от коров или людей - кровавая каша. Мешают соперники или полицейские? В чем проблема их отправить к остальным в мир инной?

[h1]Геймдизайн[/h1]

Сногсшибательные уровни, пропитанные адреналином и напряженной атмосферой. Тут вам и мертвая петля [spoiler](для второго уровня весьма неплохо, так ведь?)[/spoiler], и кислота, и еще много всякого доставляющего НЁХа. Море экшена и драйва не только при пролете над пропастью, но и при обыкновенным погружением под воду. Все это сопровождается отличным звуком и музыкой.

[h1]Графика и звук[/h1]

Взрыв шаблона возникает и от этих двух штукенций: помимо великолепного геймплея доставляет музыка, звуки, эффекты и сама графика. Претензий нет.

[h1]Релизы на других платформах и издания[/h1]

Android и iOS издания имеют улучшенное меню, также есть возможность доната в обмен на открытые тачки и трассы, слегка улучшена детализация текстур. Издание на Sony Playstation не отличается от версии на PC. В Steam-версии Carmageddon имеет подпись Max Pack - издание с оригинальной игрой и дополнением - Splat Pack, включающий новые уровни и автомобили; изначально Splat Pack выпускался как отдельная игра, под которую была сделанна даже [url=http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/carmageddon/images/a/a6/Carmasplatboxuk.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20151020173008]отдельная обложка[/url].

[h1]Также:[/h1]

Игра дается бесплатно вместе с Carmageddon: Max Damage. Есть мультиплеер (не в курсе по поводу его жизнедеятельности), коллекционные карточки. Эмуляция воспроизводится через DOSbox, и весьма нормально. Игра вполне играбельна на новых PC.

[b]Итог:[/b] ИМХО, одна из лучших игр на PC и Sony Playstation, мастхэв, мастплэйд. Ну же, размажь уже кого-нибудь по стенам, будь-то пешехода, будь-то машину!

Оценка: 10/10.

34340958.review:
When I'd first gotten Carmageddon back in the day, I'd gotten just the CD, no manual or instructions, so I didn't know what sort of game it was. I think I was familiar with the idea of racing games with weapons, but I'd always thought that racing was an important part of it.

In Carmageddon, racing is probably the least important part of the game.

The first time I tried it out, I tried running through the checkpoints. Even then, I was aware of how bad I am at games, and wondered at how I'd managed to leave everyone behind. But I kept losing the race because I'd run out of time. Why wasn't I getting time for going through the checkpoints? Was I missing any shortcuts?

Then I tried it again, and went off the track...

Carmageddon was advertised as a "vehicular combat game". There are three ways to win a race. You could try and run through the checkpoints, but you'd still have to find a way to build up enough time to do so. You could fight and "waste" your opponents (by ramming into them, or ramming them into something; no ranged weapons here), or by killing each and every one of the hundreds of pedestrians on the map.

It's quite clear what the game expected you to do.

You gain time by running over pedestrians, damaging and killing your opponents, or running over green barrels scattered (and hidden) off the track. There are various power-ups, also in different coloured-barrels, which range from the very useful (solid granite car, electro-bastard ray), to the weird (instant handbrake, giant pedestrians) to the terrible-but-in-a-fun-way (bounce-bounce, jelly suspension). You can repair your car at any time, but it costs you money, money which you'd earned by running through checkpoints, killing pedestrians, killing opponents, or doing weird things like flipping your car several times off of track geometry (cunning stunt bonus).

Money can be used between races to upgrade your car in three areas, offence, defence and speed. I think that the upgrades apply to all of the cars in your garage, but I'm not entirely sure. To be honest, I'm still not sure how cars were unlocked. Every once in a while, a car that you wasted will become unlocked for you to race around in, but I'm pretty sure it was random. Not every car is unlockable, so no Countslash, no De'Gory'Un. Sorry. In later games, you could buy them out, but here you just get them randomly, and it's only a small portion of them.

You start out with a choice between two cars and drivers, Max Damage with his Eagle, and Di Anna with her Hawk, cars which look similar, but had different stats and different engine placements. Di Anna, I felt, had an unfair advantage, because you'd have less to repair after every crash since her engine was well out of the way during the various head-on collisions you'd go through.

The music is by, according to the wiki, Fear Factory, which explains why it sounded so familiar. No lyrics, but it is loud and heavy. 

It still looks pretty good for a DOS game. Yes, this game is in DOS, and Steam runs it in DOSbox. It runs very smoothly, even (or rather, especially) the 3DFX version. You wouldn't think you were running a 20-year-old game. The damage-model is especially nice, with different areas of the car deforming from impacts and crashes.

I wonder why all of my favourite games were open world and had extensive damage models? Something to think about...

The feel of the car isn't very racing game-ish. Modern racing games are very sensitive about grip and drifting, but Carmageddon is a bit... floatier? Not sure if that's right. The cars will skid around, and different surfaces will be treated differently, but it really isn't a racing game. It's not bad, but after something like Mantis Burn Racing (or even Gas Guzzler Extreme), you can tell that this isn't a hardcore racer.

I got Carmageddon Max Pack free when I bought Carmageddon Max Damage. It's still downloading, so I thought I'd give this old thing a whirl. It holds up pretty well, I'm just not sure if you should buy it. I got it for free, so I'm happy, though I'm not sure if I'll play it if I have the newer, prettier version around. I got them both for USD 5.00, and I'm surprised that this bundle wasn't advertised more heavily.

Download it for your tablet or mini-PC, Carmageddon is a part of gaming history. Just don't pay too much for it.

33360735.review:
In my opinion, this game is great for those looking for a fun racing game and or some 1990's nostalgia.

The gameplay is extremely fun, especially when you start picking up power-ups like "Acme Damage Magnifier," which increases the damage you do to other cars, and "Solid Granite Car" which does exactly what it sounds like.

A major downside is that, to my current knowledge, there is no free play mode, unlike in Reincarnation and Max Damage. So you can't say "I want to have nearly unlimited time and credits for this race!" or something like that.

The vehicles are quite an interesting bunch. There's sports cars, trucks, racing cars, hearses and dune buggies, just to name a few. You can unlock some of these vehicles by wrecking them when they are "Stealworthy," although the game doesn't tell you when they are, or, at least not in my play time. Not all vehicles are playable, though. Each vehicle has a damage model.

The physics lean on the side of realistic, opposed to arcadey.

The damage modeling is hugely advanced for 1997. Some games today don't match up. A major downside is that no parts come off of the car and, sometimes, the car will start to "tear apart" and have transparent patches.

The vehicle modeling is slightly below average, the car bodies are good but the wheels are blocky. The windows on all vehicles are chromatic, so you cannot see inside. There is an interior view option, but the interior appears to just be a .GIF of the dashboard, pictured inside of the vehicles.

The pedestrians, which are the, pun intended, meat and bone of the Carmageddon series, are bitmap sprites. The animation is pretty good all things considered. If you hit a pedestrian, they explode into a pile of pixelated gore.

The graphics are average for 1997. Draw distance is a bit close due to the size of the maps.

This game is a tricky if you aren't absolutely amazing at racing games. The opponents basically have the mindset of every Grand Theft Auto Online player ever. There are police in big trucks, too, and they compound this. The game also does not give you much time...You start with 1:30 on the clock. If it reaches 0, you lose. Hitting pedestrians, smashing opponents at speed and doing cool stunts gets you more time.

The soundtrack is small, but good. It features three Fear Factory songs as well as a few 90s-tacular electronica songs.

This game takes some grinding to get through, unless you rack up the credits like a madman. You can gain credits through the same ways as gaining time, as well as going through checkpoints.

There is no traffic to my knowledge, just scattered parked and junked cars.

The level design is...Well, I haven't really fiddled around enough with racing through the levels to tell you. The maps are decently sized, though.

The controls are a bit silly to me. But, then again, I rarely play PC games.

The heads up display is lackluster. You have to push a button to bring up the map. Camera is slow to rotate outside of the car, and only shows one of three directions in the interior view. One of the game's gimmicks is the "Prat Cam," where there is a .GIF of your selected player model reacting to how horrible your driving is.

Overall, if you can take the mental trousers A.I. and playing the same fun levels over and over again, I absolutely recommend this game.

31232483.review:
Ever since the 1990's, when 3D gaming was still an infant, they constantly pushed the boundries of what was possible. Whether it would be a 3D shooter game, racing game, RPG game, or a strategy game, they all played well and looked good.

Carmageddon is no exception. Ever since this game came out during teh 1990's, it's been the hottest racing game ever. Not just because it's a racing game, but it's a racing with a challenge as well as having mini goals. You're not just racing to survive, but you're also racing to smack the hell out of as many pedestrians as possible. With the many kinds of odd racing out there, this one is still king (IMHO) as well as started it all.

Course, you don't have to just go through all the check points to win the race, just bash the hell out of some other racers and take them out of the race to win. The only challenge is that you don't get much time to do this, as the timer ticks down the longer you are racing.

For those who are not familiar with the game, some of the many features include...

1.) Gain time by running over people, performing cool stunts, or smacking racers just right
2.) Power ups lay all over the race which give you either land mines, extra time, or a spiked tail (Don't ask)
3.) Ability to buy vehicles and upgrades as you progress through the game
4.) Gain money by winning the race, killing all other racers, smacking peds, or performing stunts
5.) Many race tracks and 40+ (Main game + Splat pack) vehicles to choose from
6.) Complete open worlds, explore to your hearts content on each race track
7.) Peds count ranges from 200+ to 500+ per race track
8.) Race hard enough, and earn the super armoured police vehicle

And so much more. Keep in mind of course that the graphics are not up to par with todays 3D gaming, but then the game is over 20 years old.

Overall, a fun killing spree with a feel of a racing game, and with so many cars to choose from, you will want to race even harder to get those vehicles in your list. Race against other racers, slam some peds, and bash other racers out of the way. What more could you want in a racing game?

29993987.review:
To think this game came out in 1997 yet is still so playable and satisfying today with its solid gameplay.

CARMAGEDDON is a pure visceral thrill ride of stress venting that leaves me totally relaxed afterwards with its amazing though exaggerated physics system as one crashes into oppenant's racing cars seeing them take physical dents along with falling parts damage from the high speed impact. Its great to see touches of realism like ones engine smoking after taking a headon collision. This same smoke will obscure your vision just enough to make hitting oppenants and pedestrians a bit more difficult but in a fun non frustrating way.

Enemy ai is very well done with them giving the illusion of having their own purposes. Sometimes they'll ignore you while going against other racers and other times they'll hunt you down for many a street city block especially if you just bumped into them "accidently" :D Pedestrians will scream in terror at your approach and will start running for their stinking lives when they see you racing like a bat out of hell down the street.

Graphics are sweet in their brutality. It is quite a joy mowing down an old granny in a walker who reminds you of a certain passive aggressive senior citizen we have all had to deal with. CARMAGEDDON takes the wait out of waiting for the nursing home staff to show up to take them away as they scream in terror before you pile drive them with your race car against a building wall sending guts eyeballs and entrails flying everywhere. Ooo and what a squishy sound they make as i run over their dead bodies afterward. Then theres the sexy boys... ooo i hate sexy boys!

Sound effects are top notch from the screeching grind of cars rubbing up against a building to the POW! of crashing into public telephones and street lights. Its a real riot hearing pedestrians death screams when scoring points for killing them along with time bonuses. If one does a fancy move or stunt while killing them one is awarded even more points and or cash. Hearing your character cracking jokes or cursing really adds to the sense of immersion.

A timeless classic full of black humor and relaxing venting still absolutely playable and still gives any "modern" racing game a run for its money.

Thanks Interplay and SCi for the endless fun :D

29766034.review:
Carmageddon fue uno de los juegos que marcó mi infancia. Un clásico de los juegos de conducción, por su violencia (algo nunca visto en un juego de coches por aquel entonces) y por su frenetismo y diversión,con carreras a velocidades de infarto y llenas de violentos choques y atropellos. Salió en el 97 y 20 años después aún lo sigo disfrutando como el primer día.

Esta versión es exactamente la misma que el clásico de PC, con lo bueno y lo malo que ello conlleva. Como positivo pues tiene todo lo que hacía bueno al original, Como negativo pienso que era bastante fácil habérselo currado mucho más como sí han hecho con la versión para móviles, que incluye mejoras gráficas y en jugabilidad, logros, etc. Podrían haberse currado un port de la versión de móviles a PC ya que lo tenían hecho, pero de todas formas se agradece la posibilidad de poder rejugar este clásico tal y como lo conocimos en su día.

Os dejo mi lista de pros y contras:

PROS:

- Uno de los juegos de conducción más míticos de todos los tiempos

- La violencia

- La sencilla jugabilidad

- Las físicas

- La sensación de velocidad

- Los míticos vehículos

- Poder acabar las carreras de tres formas: llegando el primero a la meta, matando a todos nuestros oponentes o matando a todo ser viviente del nivel

- Funciona perfectamente en ordenadores y sistemas operativos actuales (probado en Windows 10 de 64bits y en varios ordenadores actuales)

- Posibilidad de jugarlo con la aceleración 3D de 3DFX

- Incluye la música

- La policía y su brutalidad

- La variedad de vehículos

- La enorme extensión de los escenarios

- La posibilidad de mejorar el coche

- El modo replay para ver desde cualquier ángulo y en cualquier momento las repeticiones más bestias

- Tiene modo multijugador

- Las deformaciones de los vehículos

- Tiene cromos Steam


CONTRAS:

- Se podían haber currado bastante más esta edición de Steam como sí han hecho con la versión para móviles

- No tiene sistema de guardado en la nube como sí tiene la versión para móviles

- Inferior técnicamente a la versión de móviles, podían haberla porteado

- No tiene logros Steam

- muchas veces tendremos que ir a buscar a los rivales que estarán volcados por el escenario sin poder moverse

- Ganar las carreras destruyendo a los rivales es un método bastante sencillo dada su poca resistencia en comparación con la de nuestro vehículo

- Totalmente en inglés 

- Precio algo elevado para un juego tan antiguo si se compra por separado, mejor esperar a las ofertas como hice yo


CONCLUSIÓN: Su diversión, sencilla jugabilidad, las realistas deformaciones de los vehículos, la física de los coches, la conducción, la brutalidad y la violencia, la posibilidad de terminar las carreras de varias formas... hacen de él un auténtico juegazo que ya obtuvo valoraciones sobresalientes en su época hayá por el 97 y que aún a día de hoy hará disfrutar a los más nostálgicos y a los que no pudieron disfrutarlo en su día pero quieren conocer uno de esos juegos que marcó un antes y un después en la historia de los videojuegos.


Si mi análisis te ha servido de ayuda o te ha gustado, agradecería que dejaras tu valoración positiva para que pueda leerlo más gente. No dudéis en escribir abajo si tenéis cualquier tipo de duda. ¡Un saludo y gracias por leerme!

28445505.review:
Добро пожаловать в мир крови и разрушения! В мир где дорожное полотно заляпано кровью, завалено телами и разбитыми машинами!

Игрушка вышла в конце 90-ых, но до сих пор остаётся популярной среди геймеров. На выбор у нас два водилы. Знакомьтесь, Max Damage и Die Anna! Оба сумашедшие, так как получают удовольствие от сбивания пешеходов с животными и разбивания противников! :) Макс ездит на красном Eagle, Анка же на желтом Hawk.

Видел в интернете, что кто-то пугал народ "Бойтесь! Ведь поколение, которое выросло на GTA, начало получать водительские удостоверения!". Нашли чем пугать! Поколение, которое выросло на Кармагеддоне уже давно получило эти удостоверения! :) Вернёмся к обзору.

И так, мы выбрали своего водилу. Теперь мы можем зайти в магазин запчастей и поглядеть что же нам доступно. Нам доступно по одному улучшению каждого параметра нашей тачанки (сила удара, мощность и усиление конструкции), но вот купить мы их не можем - денег нихт! :) Поэтому выбираем одну из трёх доступных для нашего рейтинга трасс и начинаем зарабатывать деньги. Пробуем проехать все круги, по дороге собираем на бампер пешеходов и соответственно пытаемся ушатать противников. Пока собирали пешеходов едва не проворонили появление ментов! В самом начале с ними лучше не тягаться в плане "кто кого затаранит до смерти", не позволяют конструкция и сила удара. А вот соперников нужно заставить потягаться. Не забываем собирать бочки с бонусами, но будте осторожны с красными бочками! Там может выпасть абсолютно любой бонус, будь-то увеличение силы удара или проклятая пружина (машина подпрыгивать будет). У меня так было однажды. Открыл карту, смотрю соперник стоит впереди меня, застрял он, ну я соответственно по газам и понёсся на него. По дороге прихватил красную бочку и вот тут началось веселье! Машина подпрыгивает, Макс орёт, я сижу нервничаю попаду или нет по сопернику. Когда до соперника остаётся всего каких-то 10 метров, машина подпрыгивает в очередной раз и мы с Максом пролетаем над застрявшим соперником (пи-и-и-ип, пи-и-и-ип пружина! пи-и-и-ип...)! Так что вот такие пирожки с котятами! :)

Каким образом тут открываются машины и улучшения параметров, я не помню (хотя проходил игрушку когда-то).

26839113.review:
Легендарная игра.
На дворе был 1998 год, когда всеми правдами и неправдами заполучил диск с настоящей лицензией и работающим оригинальным саундтреком от Fear Factory, это была невероятная роскошь и богатство, много кто просил поиграть и был готов на все ради этого диска с обращались как с величайшей реликвией всего двора, а то и всего района.
Больше года диск ходил от человека к человеку принося в его жизнь огромное удовльствие, кучу кровищи, мяса и шикарный саундтрек, после чего вернулся к своему хозяину без единой царапинки и занял почетное место на полке шедевров игровой индустрии.
Еще много лет все с тем же трепетом с него сдувалась пыль и диск вставлялся в старенький cd-rom, продолжая приносить все ту же радость что и раньше, но уже со вкусом ностальгии.
И вот теперь когда уже не кряхтит старенький cd-rom, и прошло больше 15 лет, все с тем же удовольствием сдуваешь пыль с коробочки в которой лежит все так же идеально чистый без единой царапинки диск который заслужил покой и нажимаешь кнопку установить игру в стиме.

26122485.review:
Carmageddon is a vehicular combat 'racing' game by UK developer Stainless Software released in 1997 to much acclaim for its advanced car damage model and sandbox style freedom and plenty of controversy for its depictions of gory carnage against defenseless pedestrians. This lead to an initially censored release for the UK version with zombies that bled green, the only way it was allowed to be sold until a patch was released later on to restore the original palette. The German version didn't fare much better however and was given robots instead that bled oil. Carmageddon's main inspiration comes from the 1975 film Death Race 2000 and was originally going to be a tie-in game but licensing fell through on more than one occasion, to the point Stainless said stuff it let's just get it out.

Carmageddon's a free-for-all race where you're encouraged to do whatever you want whenever you like and there is no restrictions on where you can go or what is considered fair or cheating. Your opponents will often be boring enough to race around the circuit and collect their weak paychecks from the checkpoints scattered about. Your opponents can't actually win anything however and there is no position of your standing in the race on your HUD. That's because you don't have one, and it doesn't matter anyway. What does matter is causing as much chaos as possible by either running down pedestrians, and in creative and gorier ways to net additional credits, and ramming the other cars. Wasting an opponent will give you a lot of credits, and more time than any other activity.

There's a timer that counts down at the beginning of each event and all manner of shenanigans will give you extra to allow you to explore the environment at your heart's content. For all manner of juicy bonuses and hidden bonus dosh/time and various PUPs (power-ups in Carma slang) litter the circuit and the outskirts of the race. These can be pretty gosh darned handy, for example complete invulnerability, acme damage magnifier for really putting a dent in your opponents, or pedestrian electro bastard ray for 30 seconds. The wacky power-downs however come in a sizable variety and are usually harmless enough, but make your vehicle harder to drive for a short period of time. Pinball mode though is a worthy mention as its especially nasty and you'll want to recover ASAP if you're flung into orbit to prevent reparing serious damage.

You cannot actually be wasted yourself (at least in this first installment) but credits earned during the race are often used to repair your car, and repairing and recovering when you're on your roof or side will be happening a lot. So it's crucial to scouring and looting the race as much as possible to get more money to have enough left over at the end of a race. If you lose more than you make during a race and you didn't have much left over to begin with when you began the race your bank will go into a screaming fit and pull the plug, and this constitutes as 'game over' here. Failing a race by running out of time isn't penalizing though and you can simply jump back in and try again. You use credits earned between races to upgrade your car's abilities via APO (armor, power, offensive), which are bare-bones as upgrades come and simply make you more resistant to impacts, more horsepower, and dish out extra abuse when colliding into your opponents.

All races are won in three Carma fashions: Kill all pedestrians, waste all opponents, or complete all laps. The latter is reserved for ponces however and won't really give you a whole lot of credits but it's there to sate your particular needs, you weirdo. Murdering every ped is no easy feat however, but most levels usually have a Pedestrian Respawn or two (or three) somewhere and memorizing the locations of these after you wipe out a quarter or two of the population and going back for it can give you an extra edge. Participating in races is also done by a ranking system (which was brought back in Reincarnation/Max Damage) and you start at a lowly 99 with three races to choose from and the penultimate goal is to be number one, along the way will be more challenging environments with more unhinged opponents (and cops in APCs who just refuse to get out of the way). Getting hundreds of thousands of credits an event will move the rank much more (up to 5 increases max or none whatsoever if you're absolute tripe).

The player can choose between two drivers at the start and a difficulty determining starting time in a race, credits and bonus time earned from activities and how aggressive your opponents are. It's best to start on 'normal' and see how you fare, and if you're the kind of person who hides under the table during thunderstorms then easy mode should be right up your alley. Max Damage and Die Anna are the main 'heroes' of the Death Race and drive a similar model of car. Max's all-round great Eagle is better suited to rammin' and slammin' however whereas Anna's Hawk is a faster but less strong car. Nevertheless Carmageddon is an early supporter of equality, and all manner of men and women are subjected to the same treatment. Be it behind the wheel or roadkill in the street. Sometimes when you waste a specific opponent you have a chance of stealing and adding it to your collection. Some of these can be very powerful, others not so much. Beating the game will unlock every single one, including those labeled as 'cheat', your reward for being the baddest dude.

Visually the game is competent, with adequate detail for the environments, early 3D models for vehicles and props that are well designed and pedestrians are rendered as 2D sprites via digitized actors. Their deaths are often extremely gruesome, easily making this the goriest entry of the series even with later installments featuring 3D peds that can lose their limbs. Sound design is loud and crunchy, and impacts with the environment and opponents feel very raw, and the peds incredibly nasty and satisfying. The soundtrack also features four tracks from Fear Factory's 1995 album Demanufacture in instrumental only form, most fitting choice given the game's militant gameplay in a pseudo-apocalyptic near future world.

I have very few complaints with the way this game plays, maybe that it goes on for far too long (36 races) especially if you're trying to do the best you can on each race which can run anywhere from 45 minutes to an hour on average. Late game opponents become real damage sponges if you don't nick a better set of wheels (the Eagle/Hawk just won't cut it even at max stats) and cops are extremely difficult to waste and become very common near the end but if you manage to steal an especially hard to acquire ride in the event 'Blood on the Rooftops' you will know sweet, sweet revenge for all the trouble they were giving you early on and finish the last handful of events with pure bloody malice.

Carmageddon is decidedly British in its portrayal of humor, with plenty of tongue-in-cheek jokes, British slang, and raunchiness suited for a mature audience. Which only makes sense given the dev is UK based. There's plenty of pop culture references from the era, akin to games like Duke Nukem 3D (even has a reference to OJ Simpson here too!). This should've been more than enough proof that Carmageddon's intentions were never meant to be mean-spirited or shock jockery (a suggestion to add pregnant women peds was flat out no'd), just the kind of things that make the devs piss themselves laughing. And you can tell they had a great time putting this game together, a real labor of love. Carmageddon also has an equally humorous and interesting development history if you look into it more. If you think most racing games are too dull and traditional and you want to insert more mayhem in to your driving experience than this game comes as highly recommended! And if you still can't get enough the Splat Pack expansion has even more content to offer. The antidote to all racers.

4.0/5

25180414.review:
[u]What I liked about the game[/u]

•	The gameplay can be very addictive and fun, especially when you're running over pedestrians and destroying other drivers. 
•	I liked the idea that you can see the driver in the top left-hand corner, seeing his facial expressions, when something happens during the level.  
•	You have three different ways of winning each level. My favourite was destroying other drivers. 
•	I liked the arcade style of the game.
•	The vehicles in the game are awsome, You can also unlock other driver's vehicles and use them in other levels. 
•	You can upgrade your car. 

[u]What I disliked or was disappointed with[/u]

•	Can be frustrating sometimes, police can be a pain in the arse. Sometimes you don't get credits when you should. Sometimes the last driver can prove tricky to kill. 
•	The vehicles in the game can be hard to control. The vehicle brakes aren't very good and sometimes turning a corner is like turning a ship.
•	Out of the three different ways of beating the level, destroying each driver is probably the best way to beat the level, because killing a certain number of pedestrians takes too long and doing the laps isn't very rewarding.
•	The soundtrack does get repetitive and so does the gameplay, especially towards the end. 
•	It's a shame you can't visually see the upgrades you made to the car. 
•	When playing Carmageddon on dosbox, dosbox seems to flicker a lot, especially when the game is loading the main menu. When the game is loading up, I keep seeing my internet browser and a message flicker on and off.
When I double click to skip the intro sometimes I return to my internet browser and when I click back on the application to return to the game, dosbox black screens. 
	  
 
[u]Conclusion[/u] 

A fun and addictive game, which is different compared to over racing games. It can get repetitive, but I still recommend it to any retro gaming fan. 
70/100

20718109.review:
Ahh, Steam me dando alegrias mais uma vez. Atropelar o pedestre da bandeira sempre foi uma boa sensação.

Poder jogar Carmageddon novamente foi muito bom.
A princípio pensei que não conseguiria fazê-lo rodar no meu notebook. Mas ele já vem com o DosBox configurado para poder jogar. Basta instalar o jogo e rodar. Gostei muito.

Caso seu jogo esteja rodando com baixo FPS vá na pasta DosBox do jogo (na pasta onde o jogo foi instalado) e execute o arquivo nglide_config. Ajuste como precisar. Aqui eu coloquei o Refresh rate em 60 Hz, desativei o 3Dfx logo splash screen e desativei também o Vertical synchronization.

Pra quem jogou o jogo na época do lançamento qualquer comentário é dispensável. Mas para quem está chegando agora se prepare para um jogo sangrento.

Você pode vencer as corridas de três maneiras:
- Completando os circuitos de cada fase passando pelos checkpoints;
- Atropelando todos os pedestres das fases.
- Destruindo todos os seus oponentes.

Cada uma delas é uma diversão à parte. Mas destruir os inimigos é a mais divertida. Você pode se chocar contra eles, derrubar de pontes, empurrá-los contra bombas, etc

Mas cuidado. Eles também estão te caçando pelas pistas. E além dos carros dos outros competidores em certas fases é importante ter cuidado com os carros de polícia e uma unidade especial da polícia. Eles são mais fortes e não estão afim de te levar preso. Só o seu presunto.
[spoiler]Se quiser pegar um carro especial da polícia destrua o carro especial da polícia nas fases Blood on the Rooftops e Surreal Thing.[/spoiler]

Nas fases também existem barris com efeitos especiais. Os verdes dão dinheiro ou tempo. E os demais podem dar efeitos especiais muito bons e perigosos. Poder usar gravidade de júpiter e carro de granito foi muito bom.
E lembrar da pior maneira possível o que acontece quando pegamos um barril com modo pimbal e um buraco perto.

Como dito no fim do manual do jogo: Se você tiver pesadelos sobre pessoas estourando tente jogar dominó em vez de Carmageddon.

20578144.review:
Ah, Carmageddon, a game where you don't just race other opponents, but also try to destroy them, and run over hundreds of innocent pedestrians in the process. Wicked fun. And you are rewarded for all of this, which makes it even more fun. The game even lets you know how many pedestrians there are on each level, so you can make sure every single one is mangled.

There are some old games that I think have really good looking graphics, even though they aren't very realistic like modern games. Carmageddon is one of them. There's a grittiness and personallity to the graphics that new games don't have. The lower detail of the graphics also gives the game a little more challenge, as it can be hard to see things coming up at times (at least before you get used to the graphics}.

The game can be annoying at times though. I found the vehicle handling/controls hard to get used to as first. At least with one car, you can easily get stuck to walls, and have to steer into the wall to get free. That doesn't really stop being annoying. Also if you go too fast up a steep hill, you can end up launching off and flying way too far, and will end up needing to be recovered. These minor things don't detract from the fun though.

The game has some good music that goes good with the game. There some rock songs and some electronic songs. But if you don't like them or get tired of them, you can always turn on some Metal. Metal goes great with this game.

Carmageddon is a lot of fun. If you like games like Postal or GTA. If you like running over people, wrecking cars, and causing chaos, then you will like this game. If you haven't already played it and don't own it, then you should get it now. Or when it's on sale.

9.5/10

20443207.review:
[b]Intro[/b]
The original Carmageddon is nothing short of a blast to play. However, the Steam port is absolute dogshit. The game only runs with DOSBox and if you choose to play with NGlide, no matter the resolution or graphical detail, you will
not be getting a solid 60fps with drops down to even 20fps regularly. I have a GTX1060 and an i5 4460 and it doesn't matter. It runs like trash. I would [i]only[/i] recommend this on Steam if you don't mind very low framerates or don't
care about using DOSBox. It's unfortunate that Stainless hasn't decided to update the compatibility because if they did I could easily wholeheartedly recommend this fantastic game. 

However, I HIGHLY recommend the port for mobiles. It's practically the Gizmodo port that never came but it runs at 60fps, looks fantastic and plays like a dream even with touch controls. This is the only time ever that I'd recommend a
mobile game, especially a mobile port. It how now become the definitive version of the game. Get it.

[b]The Great:[/b]
++Graphics still hold up amazingly with a really impressive art-style
++Rich atmosphere and has the brilliant dark humour that Carmageddon II and far moreso Max Damage traded in for ludicrous over-the-top, unfunny jokes
++For 1997, the game was darn well innovative with physics and open-ended driving not seen in just about anything before
++The main gameplay is just a ton of goddamn fun

[b]The Good:[/b]
+The cars are a joy to handle
+Vehicle variety is awesome
+Very long game
+Running over peds is really enjoyable
+Racing is also fun, surprisingly
+Music is brilliant with a kickass main theme
+Multiplayer was amazing

[b]The Okay/Not Too Big of a Deal:[/b]
+-Sound is only okay in the long run

[b]The Bad:[/b]
-Not a big fan of how the upgrades and vehicle earning systems work whatsoever, although some think it's the best in the series
-The driver sounds are a pest and far too loud
-Game is pretty glitchy with audio options that don't even work and physics that tend to whack out
-Track variety is somewhat lacking and the levels themselves aren't great

[b]The Horrible:[/b]
--N/A

Sound: 4/10
Graphics: 9/10
Gameplay: 8.5/10
Content/Replayability: 8/10
Overall: 8/10

Awards:
Runner-Up Game of the Year - 1997

[b]Conclusion[/b]
As a game, Carmageddon has more than stood the test of time but in terms of compatibility with modern hardware its worse than most. I wouldn't really recommend any PC version and god knows I've tried to get it running perfectly
unless you can just deal with it, but I couldn't recommend the mobile version any more.

18570138.review:
The first / true Carmageddon game released back in 1997 !
Never actually played this one, started with Carmageddon 2 and played TDR2k so yea.. but i'm playing it now !
Its actually very fun, u can notice that the graphics are a bit behind of the other two games but as a true carmageddon fan that i am, i easily ignore that hehe.
I'm actually surprised this game has 6 more levels than the 2nd game but way less tracks, its basically diferent versions of the same, same, same tracks !
But since i'm playing it for the first time, what the hell, frack it ! :D

Ok, now the real review...
Been playing it on DosBox, its very playable, until now i haven't met any problem, besides game crashing when i messed with the files to change the draw distance, but hey, u dont need to mess with the files to begin with !
I'm surprised that the cops on this game are so frickin' hard to kill and since i'm playing on Hard dificulty(commonly known as Dificulty 3) the APO, most known as Upgrades of your car, are very very expensive on this dificulty.
I'm almost level 4 in all of the APO as of now, and i still find it hard to wreck a police car, dang.
I love the rank system on this game, u start out at rank 99 and your goal is to hit rank 1.
If i'm not mistaken i'm in between rank 59 and 55, when u get the hang of the driving in this game, its really easy to get several ranks from a single track(by "farming" alot of credits with combos from killing pedestrians) and thus, u can buy several APO.
Also, something that every carmageddon game has(and some u buy cars dont steal) its the stealworthy feature, some cars that are stealworthy u can wreck them to add them to your garage, but its not 100% chance rate to add them to the garage when u wreck them, so beware of that.
I'm trying to reach the latter levels so i can steal "The Supressor" the ultimate and most armored car on the game, like the normal cop cars. but this one has like 8 wheels or something.
So like i said before, for an old game its been running great, without problems(on dosbox ofc!) and i've been enjoying it, so far i've played for around 20 hours and i'm still a bit far from the end of the game.
I highly recommend this game !
Too bad the multiplayer is basically impossible to work at this time.
It would of been too fun !
But for that u can play the new carmageddon game, Carmageddon : Reincarnation !

Hugs and kisses for everyone !

Es divertidísimo, recupera totálmente el espíritu del primero de la saga. Las físicas son espectaculares, el coche se despieza casi por completo. Los ítems son una locura, y han mejorado el uso de los mismos permitiendo tener varios en un inventario y usarlos cuando creamos conveniente. Los circuitos son demenciales y los peatones no se ven tan descompensados de tamaño como en entregas anteriores. Una de las cosas que más me ha gustado ha sido la introducción de tipos de prueba distintos, ya no solo hay que completar una carrera de los tres modos distintos, haciendo las  vueltas, acabando con los oponentes o matando todos los peatones (tarea imposible sin el "Electric BLue") si no que también podemos jugar a cazar el zorro o a llegar al peatón primero que los demás. En resumen, el precio está muy bien para el total de horas que se pueden hacer, ya que los mapas invitan a perder el tiempo dando vueltas. No sé si aún está la oferta, pero en el momento que lo compré, incluía todas las entregas anteriores, Carmageddon Splat Pack, Carmageddon 2 y Carmageddon TDR2000.

"Slaudos"

15642334.review:
Игра представляет собой незатейливый симулятор гонок, победа в которых возможна тремя способами:
1. проехать трассу
2. привести машины всех соперников в негодность
3. переехать всех живых существ на трассе.
По правде говоря, первый и последний варианты ни разу не получалось выполнить.

Играл в эту игрушку в далёком детстве. Просто замечательно что её вместе с эмулятором запихнули в стим - прекрасный вариант понастольгировать вечером по старым играм, где по сегодняшним меркам графика тетриса, но красота идеи перебивает эти недостатки.

15592567.review:
Carmageddon - это гонка с повреждениями, в которых мы также давим людей.
Есть три пути выиграть каждую из гонок - уничтожить всех 5 соперников (разбить их машины), проехать все чекпоинты (как и в обычной гонке), либо задавить всех пешеходов (я думаю это выполнимо, если у вас есть бонус, показывающий всех пешеходов на карте). В режиме карьеры вы будете проходить различные гонки на аренах, и получая ранги, начиная с 99 (самого низкого), и кончая 1-м, самым высоким. За всё в игре вы получаете деньги (и за повреждения машин, и задавив пешеходов, и за прохождение чекпоинтов), на деньги можно будет покупать улучшения запчастей. Чиниться можно прямо во время гонки за деньги, либо вернуть машину на нормальное место, если вы застряли или перевернулись. 
Также можно выигрывать другие машины у соперников. У игры неплохой затягивающий геймплей, отличный саундтрек из метала/электронной музыки.
В детстве мне эта игра не попадалась, но многие играли в неё ещё в 90-х. Игра поставляется с DosBox-ом, но есть два пути запустить игру - либо в низком разрешении (для слабых компьютеров), либо с эмуляцией 3D-ускорителя 3DFX, он даёт намного более качественную графику (но требует более мощного компьютера). Игра всем хороша, но есть несколько минусов: нереалистичная физика (машины взлетают в воздух как птицы), нельзя переназначить клавиши управления (по умолчанию управление автомобилем - клавиши 8,4,6,2 справа клавиатуры), и не очень удачная камера - она не следит за твоим перемещением, а меняется динамически (можно поставить вид из кабины, но это не всегда удобно). 
Я почти прошёл игру, но первый раз она у меня вылетела, а во второй раз я не смог добить последнюю машину (возможно баг).
Я конечно рекомендую эту игру, она с долей садизма и нездорового юмора, но за это её и любят.

14959880.review:
[b]PROS:[/b]
+ really fun gameplay
+ great soundtrack
+ lots of tracks
+ 90s racing game feel
+ classic Carmageddon

[b]CONS:[/b]
- almost no players in multiplayer
- outdated graphics
- sound issues when running 3dfx version
- clunky controls (unable to set your own keys)

[b]Comment:[/b]
Nostalgic trip to the 90s reveals an awesome game back then that currently still is pretty good. I got this in the Carmageddon: Reincarnation bundle but honestly I bought that bundle just to get this and Carmageddon 2. I used to play the two games back in the 90s on the PC of my cousin and it was a blast. Although it has aged, this is still a nice racing game. There are some issues though. The 3dfx graphics, although older, are nice but this version caused sound issues on PC when the sound would just stop. The no-3dfx version feels a tad bit too clunky visually. The key binding is fixed and even though you can pick from 4 variants it still would have been nice to be able to configure your own setting. Also maybe worth mention is that although Steam gives you options for multiplayer it does not have many players around so it is not worth bothering. Soundtrack and effects are really really great and the racing feel you get is nice (enhanced by the big amount of tracks). A cool retro game worth recommending.

14926519.review:
Zagrywałem się w demo Carmageddon, jako dzieciak, godzinami. Gra jest świetnym lekarstwem na stres. Można wyżyć się setnie w jej, chorym i brutalnym, ale na szczęście, wirtualnym świecie.

Mechanika gry w skrócie: wybierasz samochód, stajesz do wyścigu, rozwalasz wszystkich na torze=wygrywasz, rozwalasz przechodniów (starasz się o odrobinę finezji)=zdobywasz kasę i dodatkowy czas, jesteś humanitarnym nudziarzem perfekcjonistą i unikasz wgnieceń i zadrapań, ale docierasz na metę pierwszy=wygrywasz! Proste? Banalnie! Wciąga? Nieprzyzwoicie!

Technikalia.

Grafika wśród młodszych graczy na pewno nie wywoła efektu WOW, ale szczerze? To jest jedna z tych produkcji, której wypieszczone, wypolerowane i fotorealistyczne wodotryski wizualne są zupełnie niepotrzebne (choć jak na swoje czasy gra prezentowała się przynajmniej bardzo dobrze).

W kwestii ścieżki dźwiękowej oraz samych odgłosów... niestety również słychać drobne braki technologiczne. Szumy i niska jakość sampli przy bardzo dobrym sprzęcie audio może nieco irytować. Natomiast sama jako taka ścieżka muzyczna do gry została dobrana świetnie i podkręca dodatkowo poziom adrenaliny (w skład wchodzi kilka utworów, w wersjach instrumentalnych, metalowej kapeli Fear Factory). Ilośc utworów nie jest jednak pokaźna, co z kolei może spowodować, że z czasem słuchanie tych samych kawałków, podczas dłuższej sesji, może nieco znudzić.

Podsumowanie.

Plusy:
- to jest TEN CARMAGEDDON
- krew, zombie i totalna rozwałka na torze
- dynamika rozgrywki
- absolutnie jedna z najlepszych gier wyścigowych w historii gier komputerowych
- spora ilość pojazdów, którymi można się "ścigać"

Minusy:
- powtarzalność torów
- zdarzają się framedropy (sprzęt testowy (laptop): Intel Core i7-2670QM, 8GB RAM, Nvidia GT 555M 1GB RAM, dysk SSD + dysk zewnętrzny USB 3.0)

Podsumowując. 

Totalna rozwałka, jaką można w Carmageddon sprokurować sprawia tak wiele frajdy, ściganie przechodniów i wycinanie ich w pień w szaleńczym wyścigu z czasem i równie bezwzględnymi przeciwnikami nie ma sobie równych po dziś dzień.

14838861.review:
Игра вышла 30 июня 1997 года. Разрабатывала её молодая команда Stainless Games, а издавала компания SCI. 
Начало работы над игрой начались в 1994 году. И изначально игра дожна была быть сделана по мотивам фильма "Безумный Макс", но издателю не удалось договориться с правообладателем, тогда было решено делать игру по фильму "Смертельные гонки 2000". Но и тут не чего не получилось. И разработчики решили делать игру в своём сеттинге. И идея которую компания Stainless Games воплотила в жизнь стала настоящей сенсацией в игровом мире.
Цель игры — победа в гонках одним из трёх способов: приход к финишу первым, уничтожение всех пешеходов (в среднем 500 на одной карте), либо уничтожение машин противников. Со временем появляется возможность улучшать машину за счёт заработанных денег (увеличивать параметры брони, мощности двигателя и «атакующих» поверхностей). Также, спустя некоторое время, игроку становятся доступны автомобили противников.
Каждая карта гонок была абсолютно открытая. И игрок мог заниматься всевозможными вещами. Делать трюки на своей машине, давить пешеходов, животных, уничтожать врагов, искать секреты итд. Из-за такого вида насилия на экране мониторов во многих странах запретили эту игру или же заменяли пешеходов на зомби (Великобритания), либо роботов (Германия) или применяли другую цензуру.
17 октября 2012 года было выпущено переиздание игры для iOS, а 9 мая 2013 года было выпущено переиздание игры для Android OS.
Игра была сделана на движке BRender на котором выходили такие игры как FX Fighter и Harry Potter and the Philosopher’s Stone.
Карты игры были абсолютно разнообразны Секретные лаборатории, пустыни, горные базы отдыха, города и деревни. На то время в игре наблюдалась неплохая своеобразная физика автомобилей и разрушений. Анимацию пешеходов снимали с реального человека, работника компании Тони. Так что все удары возможные в игре он примерял на своей шкуре. Так же он вместе с девушкой Фей дали внешность двум главным персонажам игры Максу и Анне. Музыка к игре была взята из альбома Demanufacture группы Fear Factory. 
Драйвовый геймплей и много часов отличной игры будут обеспечены любителям подавить пешеходов.
10/10

14419999.review: Eines der besten und realistischsten Rennspiele die es auf diesem Planeten gibt. Und der Lamborghini Countach in dem Spiel ist der Hammer! Grafik ist zwar jetzt nicht wie in GTA 5, aber es macht min. genau so viel Spaß :DD

14316569.review: In 1997 society's number one enemies were Grand Theft Auto and Carmageddon. I think later GTA games were partially influenced by Carmageddon series because it was one of the first pioneers of open-world car games in 3D world. This game is just classic. Very nostalgic vibes. I recommend it for everyone who loves GTA series, Flatout series, Destruction Derby and these kind of games. I do not recommend this for peaceful car racing/simulation gamers. This is not car porn. Tuning means something else here. This is rust and twisted metal, spikes and blades, blood, sweat and tears, smoke, oil and industrial waste. This is somekind weird radioactive-biohazard experiment with experimental killing machines with engines and innocent human beings. Just so unacceptable. Road rage at its best. If Trevor Philips ever wanted to be a car game, I'm pretty sure he would wanna be the one and only: CARMAGEDDON!!!

14030500.review:
No me gustan los juegos de carreras, pero mi unica excepcion es este. El clasico Carmageddon, un juego tabu para mi epoca (1997-2000). Que hermosos recuerdos era jugarlo a escondidas, debido a ¨lo controvertido e inlegal¨ en mi pais, ya que jugar este juego era peor visto que cualquier crimen.
 -Lo mejor
 -La libertad: pues, este fue el primer sandbox considerado por muchos y para mi lo es. Con todo los honores: Puedes salirte de la carrera y provocar todo tipo de caos, de atropellar a la gente y si terminas con todos los peatones, ganas. O completar la carrera normalmente, o ganarla de la manera injusta, matando a todos los competidores. 
 -el apartado artistico: Es muy bueno y grandioso el ambiente que le dan las texturas y los peatones(¿sabias que las animaciones de estos, son dibujos sobre una persona quien realmente era atropellada?), los colores mixtos, aunque la mayoria calidos y con textura hiperrealista. El interior de los autos era lo que mas me encantaba del juego, hasta lo considero el mejor de la saga solo por este detalle: El interior del auto esta muy bien dibujado y detallado, se combina el verdadero exterior 3D del auto, con una animacion en 2d del interior, mostrando el bolante, el velocimetro, el hud y los accesorios del piloto. Realmente una belleza.
 -La jugabilidad: Realmente muy bien lograda y con un buen realismo al estilo del auto: Estan los livianos, cuya maniobilidad es turbulenta, son rapidos, y cuesta usarlos y los pesados, quienes son lentisimos pero con un manejo excelente. Pues, hay autos solo para carreras, los medianos o solo para destruir.
 Lo malo:
 -Despues de un rato se vuelve algo monotono, un poco repititivo, ya que esto se pone así, si nos enfocamos en destruir los autos. Repito: solo se vuelve repititivo si nosotros decidimos buscar a los autos y destruirlos. Ya que si hacemos la carrera, nos encontraremos con verdaderos desafios.
 -Conseguir autos: aqui se vuelve algo complicado y fastidioso, ya que es como una ruleta: despues de una carrera alguien te desafia y estas realmente animado por ver que auto te tocó y nos topamos con los indeseados. No podemos comprar el auto que queremos, tenemos que ser desafiados por sus pilotos para obtenerlos y esto, pasa 1 de cada 10 carreras que nos tocan.
 -Inmortalidad: Asi es. Nuestros autos o mejor dicho, conductores, son realmente inmortales. Ya que lo unico que nos mata, es que se agote el tiempo. Pero no los choques ni explosiones. Algo decepcionante, ya que siempre, he querido ver la cara del conductor al ver su expresion tras ser asesinado por otro competidor o la policia. Aunque esto sea una ventaja para nosotros. Tambien, contaremos con dinero que si o si, nos sobrara para repararnos, rescatarnos y revivirnos.
 Despues de todo esto. le doy un 9 de 10. Realmente buen juego. Lastima esos pequeños detalles.

13947482.review:
Carmageddon isn't just an awesome game because it's essentially the playable version of the movie Death Race 2000 ([url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tO-YkaXGtLM]which is available in the public domain on Youtube[/url]), it's a great game because the hard difficulty turns the game from a bloody yet loose open-world pedestrian masher into an actual racing game that requires quick thinking and huge balls.

I personally think Carmageddon plays it too loose with its formula. You get huge, huge amounts of time to actually complete the race, and every car you destroy or every civilian you run down adds a not insignificant amount to it. I wanted it to be more like an actual race, one where you have to quickly explore and find the secrets in order to get enough time to either finish or kill your opponents. Something quicker and snappier. I found out that Hard mode solves all of my complaints - you start out with 30 seconds, which means you need to start driving on the sidewalk immediately to turn wholesome North American guts into fuel for your hell vehicle. It encourages breaking off from the "track" to see the city and find new exciting pedestrians to murder. It is tough as shit but it is well worth it to see all the cool hidden areas the developers thoughtfully put in. It's that or wander around the track until you decide that killing every pedestrian is a fucking tedious exercise and end up destroying the other combatants. Or finishing the race, because you are 50 years old and you need to get back to filling out your Old People Forms.

Anyway, Carmageddon is one of the greats and despite my moaning about it it's still goddamn fun to play after all these years.

13346688.review:
El gran y clásico Carmageddon, que en su epoca le dió un giro impactante a los juegos de carreras, donde justamente lo menos importante era correr, no señor. Acá se puede ganar de tres formas, corriendo, atropellando a todos los peatones del escenario o destruyendo los coches de los competidores.

En mi infancia, me tocó conocer primero al Carmageddon 2, del cuál tengo los mejores recuerdos y ahora que está en Steam lo puedo disfrutar nuevamente. Pero esta primera entrega me deja un buen sabor, es muy divertido a pesar de que se nota un gran cambio entre ambos juegos.

Hay una gran variedad de pistas y de coches, y de competidores completamente desquiciados al igual que los protagonistas Max Damage y Die Anna, y como si eso fuera poco, viene con la expansión Splat Pack que tiene nuevos circuitos que son más complejos y nuevos coches!

A diferencia del Carma 2, donde hay misiones que cumplir, en esta entrega el principal objetivo es ascender en el raking de competidores hasta llegar al puesto 1 y su vez también completar todas las carreras del juego, así que el trabajo es bastante largo. Otra diferencia es que en este juego no se pueden comprar los autos con el dinero conseguido, sino que puedes ganar algunas mientras jugás a medida que subis el ranking y el dinero solo te sirve para comprarles las mejoras. Pero como todo Carmageddon, al completar el juego vas a tener una importante colección de autos a disposición para salir a las calles a causar estragos!

ES UNO DE LOS MEJORES JUEGOS QUE JUGUÉ!! SÚPER RECOMENDADO!!

13297297.review:
Un puñetazo de nostalgia en la cara... para lo bueno y para lo malo.

Sigue invitando a la conducción por libre y la exploración de unos escenarios maravillosamente diseñados, además los controles han envejecido razonablemente bien y su humor negro (especialmente la [i]Prat Cam[/i]) mantiene ese cojonudo toque de serie B, casi Z.

Lamentablemente los movimientos de cámara pueden llegar a desesperar, especialmente con la marcha atrás y los derrapes, y eso, en un juego en el que la maniobrabilidad es tan importante, es una cagada bastante inmensa. También hay que decir que el no tener [i]power ups[/i] activos le resta algo de versatilidad.

Por último añadir que algunos usuarios tenemos ciertos problemas con el rendimiento del juego, que corre sobre Dos Box usando el nGlide 1.02

Recomendable, pese a todo, porque la mezcla de exploración, humor bobalicón y gore sigue siendo una mezcla de conceptos bastante difícil de ver en los juegos de conducción, y porque a nivel de mecánicas y tono sigue siendo razonablemente distinto de la segunda y tercera parte.

Aprovechad alguna oferta o, mejor aún, comprad [i]Carmageddon: Reincarnation[/i] y lleváos la colección completa.

12926329.review:
[h1] Всех на свалку [/h1]

Хм, с его бы начать...
Пожалуй, с того, что Carmageddon вызывает у меня те самые теплые и приятные воспоминания о тех временах, когда трава была зеленее и деревья выше, а именно 97-ой год, когда я впервые открыл для себя эту потрясающую гоночную аркаду.

Что и говорить, ребята из Stainless Software постарались на славу, когда сотворили этот шедевр! Да и с названием игры попали в самую точку.

Основа игры - это, конечно, увешанные шипами и лезвиями ревущие агрессивные тачки. А зачем нам все эти обвесы? Конечно, чтобы пускать на фарш соперников, а также всех других личностей, которым "посчастливилось" оказаться на нашем пути. Спортсмены, девушки в бикини, мужчины в строгих деловых костюмах, бабульки, коровы.. все они прекрасно разлетаются на кровавые ошметки и дают нам драгоценные секунды времени дабы еще больше покрушить и передавить все вокруг, ну и кончно же кредиты с помощью которых мы можем прокачать свои колеса. Кстати, о колесах. Тут в наличии самые разнообразные рыдваны, которые различны не только по форме и цвету, но и по управлению.

Самое интересное, что заезды можно выигрывать разными путями, а именно: проходить чекпоинты (что слишком скучно), передавить всех пешиков (что слишком долго) или превратить в груду искареженного металла своих соперников (что самое и оно). И все это под саунд Fear Factory! О да!

В карме присутствует куча карт, где можно отлично погонять и устроить вакханалию на дорогах, правда некоторые из них являются по-сути, всего лишь переделками старых.

Что касается изъянов, то самый жирный - это кривая оптимизация и низкое разрешение.  DOSBox? 320x200? Да вы издеваетесь.

Цена в 249 рубчиков, конечно великовата для олдскула, но тут каждый решает сам.

12593844.review:
The noblest pursuit of all gamers and petrol heads is encompassed by this masterpiece of digital entertainment.

A timeless classic has been brought back from near extinction. The cumbersome obstacles such mastering the reverse-engineered DOSbox and the long outdated supported Operating Systems and 3DFX cards of yester year are no longer the illuminating beacons holding the guiding light toward vast citiscapes of twisted metal and burning rubber.

Here, today, on this mighty platform we can share the elation of blazing through crowds of gormless pedestrians and wildstock, the exhilaration of t-boning your adversaries with an oversized dump truck and the exhaustion of being rammed all night long, unrestricted, uncensored and untainted by the passage of time. 

Do I recommend this game? Yes.
Was my childhood a bright one? Yes.
Will you be forever ruined as an upstanding citizen of your country? It goes without saying, but... YES.

12587387.review:
This is the classic that paved the way for many racing games to come. 
This is a game that in 1997 created the racing game sandbox experience that would become a staple for the genre only many years after. 

The way cities are sectioned into multiple tracks, and the way it doesn't impose a single objective, the way you can change focus between doing checkpoints, running over pedestrians, wrecking your opponents or just exploring the sandboxes is so ahead of it's time that even now, almost 20 years after it's release and after the mist of controversy has dissipated, it still feels fresh and an achievement in videogame design.

That it's gameplay and it's itch can still be scratched only by itself even now, so many years after it's release and so many clones in between says much more than anything that has probably been written.

12419964.review:
На мой взгляд одна из первых популярных игр ПК. Она была в то время когда компьютер был не у всех. И можно было поиграть только в компьютерном клубе. Разрешение было 320х240, но это не мешало получать положительные эмоции от игры. Когда и ещё и прикрутили поддрержку 3DFX -  это вообще стала бомба (революционное разрешение 640х480- это вам не это...). Приобрёл игру из-за ностальгии. Причём Карма вышла ещё и на мобильных устройствах (я её прошёл там на самом сложном уровне), но  там не было дополнения Splat Pack.

12416674.review:
This game I got as a gift from a friend and holy...goddamn it takes me back some 15+ years back into my mid-teens....I missed this game so much!!

For the ones that dont know, this game was based on the 1970's film Death Race 2000. This game become an instant cult hit back then when games were going through the hard time of being too violent ect.  It stood out because, yes it was graphic and violent, but also it was a different sort of racing game.  In such you can win a race by doing all the checkpoints in order and doing laps like a regular race, wrecking your opponents cars ( my tactic of choice ) or killing every single pedestrian on the map.

Along with these unique races come proper zany as hell power ups.  Like my faves Solid Granite Car and Pedestrian Electro-Bastard Ray...yes thats a thing...and many more, even combining into some outstanding effects.

The AI racers also have some good AI as well.  They are set in their ways and go about racing their own way.  Some wanna race, some wanna run over peds and some just wanna turn around and ram you all shapes to Sunday.

Yes the game looks dated, so what!?  its a great game to begin with and has a sweet soundtrack, with 3 tracks supplied by Fear Factory from their album Demanufacture.

Nice and simple upgrade system, no fussing around or logic needed, just choose either upping your Offense, Armour or Speed.   

All in all I am personally pleased this game has made it to Steam and give a new generation a chance at what was once one of the worlds more controversial games.

11721016.review:
Carmageddon is an absolute classic and one of the best driving games you will ever play.
The Story and goal of each level is basically: Run over pedestrians, destroy your opponents, win races :P
One of the main features that set Carmageddon apart from other racing games is the variety of ways you can win each race as well as the wide open maps.

The easiest way to win each race is to just destroy your opponents and while your opponents get stronger the further you progress, the Power. Armour and Speed upgrades you can put on to your car will help immensely.
The other 2 ways are the bog standard checkpoint route and running over every single pedestrian which will take a LOT of time as there are hundreds of them every race and hidden all over the track.
There are also plenty of powerups strewn throughout the races both fun and useful such as an electro ray and frozen opponents, or disadvantageous to you such as jelly suspension and turbo cops.
Speaking of cops, you will occasionaly encounter them as you first play but towards the end there will be cops around almost every corner and are very hard to destroy making the later courses fairly difficult.

The graphics are still very playable to this day with nice car and damage modelling, funny pedestrian sprites and a decent variety of track layouts to explore. The audio is equally decent with a kickass soundtrack from Fear Factory and the crashes and clangs of each car not to mention the funny quips from your pratcam driver.
With over 30 cars to drive when completed and over 30 tracks to complete there is plenty of value to be had, not to mention the splat pack expansion which adds an additional 20 tracks and cars each.

Overall Carmageddon is a timeless classic that all oldskool pc gamers and racing fans will enjoy,

11281674.review:
Ah, Carmageddon, a hideously beautiful relic of my misanthropic adolescence, back from the grave. 
This is a DOSBox-emulation-and-all resurrection, so while I'm happy to say it's still damned entertaining to play, most of the old issues remain, or have worsened with time. The cartoon physics are as spotty as ever, and the rock-stupid A.I.  goes from quaint to frustrating in five minutes flat. As is the sad fate of nearly every early use of 3-D graphics, the game's visuals have aged horribly: The low maximum draw distance is the most harmful to gameplay, but the game's entire appearance is so primitive that it can take a minute before your eyes can even decode the blobby, jagged blur of early polygon magic whizzing by you. All of that said, none of that completely negates that one most important thing: FUN. Nasty, sneering, blood-drenched fun. Making cars go smash, plowing through churchgoers, and, for the more advanced student, crushing and electrocuting two entire football teams, all remain as satisfactory as ever.
Bottom line, it's a bit of cult gaming history, perfect for fans of racing and comedic ultra-violence alike. Buy it for the snotty, sneering little twerp inside of us all.

Don't go into this expecting a story. Go into it for completion, for upgrading your car and becoming more proficient in killing everything in sight, and you'll love this game beginning to end.
